The Real Leadership Lessons of Steve Jobs

Six months after Job's death, the author of his best-selling biography identifies the practices that every CEO can try to emulate. by Walter lsaacson

His saga is the enterepreneurial creation myth wrie large: Steve Jobs confounded Apple in his parents' garage in 1976, was ousted in 1985, returned to rescue it from near bankruptcy in 1997, and by the time he died, in October 2011, had built it into the worl'd most valuable compnay. Along the way he helped to transform seen industries: personal computing, animated movies, music, phones, tablet computing, retail stores, and digital publishing. he thus belongs in the pantheon of America's great innovators, along iwth Thomas Edison, Henry Ford, and Walt disney. None of these men was a saint, but long after thier personalities are forgoten, history will remember how they applied imagination to technology and business
